message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $11,500. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable. Let me know what you think.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10,000. I'm really interested in the product, but I have a limited budget.

Bob, I understand your budget constraints. I'm willing to come down a bit, but $10,000 simply doesn't work for me. How about we split the difference and I offer it to you for $10,750? It's a fair price for both of us.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $10,750 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $10,375. I'm really interested in the product, and I'm willing to pay a premium, but I need to stay within my budget.

Bob, I understand you're working with a budget, but $10,375 is still a bit too low for me. How about we compromise and settle on $10,500? This is a fair price for both of us and allows me to make a reasonable profit.
I'm getting close to my limit, but I'm still not comfortable with $10,500. I'll try to meet you in the middle again, so I'll offer $10,250. I really think this is the best price I can afford.

Bob, I appreciate your efforts, but $10,250 is still a little low for me.  I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer the product for $10,375.  This is a good deal for both of us, and it allows me to make a decent profit while still staying within your budget.  What do you say?

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated, to be honest. I've been willing to meet you in the middle multiple times, but I still can't quite get to a price that works for both of us. I'll try one more time, so I'll offer $10,000. If this isn't acceptable, I'll have to consider buying from John.
